1.title: So it begins.

1111.content:
You are Brother Stevens, a priest of the Holy Light training at Northshire Abbey. Lessons have recently finished and you are enjoying the serene and sunny gardens. A scroll rest across your knee, written on which is a holy spell you have been trying to learn - Mind Control. With it, you would be able to possess any humanoid. A master of the spell would even be able to borrow the bodies of beasts, golems, or inanimate objects.

Unfortunately, you haven't even got past the basics yet. Your soul stubbornly refuses to elope form its mortal shell.

For the last time, you sit with your eyes closed, the warm sun on your face, speaking the words on the scroll, when something changes. Even though you haven't opened your eyes, you can see your surroundings. Your point of view seems to be floating and, as you look down, you see your own body slumped as though asleep on the orchard bench.

The disorientation of seeing yourself out of body is enough to break the concentration required to maintain the astral projection. However, instead of snapping immediately back to your own body, your soul tumbles away, further and further, eventually finding a body in-
1111.title: Priest

choices: Stay and get married for her.
11111.content:
For Emma Stonewall, it was another day in Elwynn Forest. The birds were chirping. The cows were grazing. And she was stuck into marrying a boy she didn't even like. Her parents had always been poor farmers who could barely get by feeding seven children. John Jameson on the other hand came from a very well to do family in Stormwind. Unfortunately, John was a complete snob who looked down on anyone with not enough wealth as his family. His only interest in Emma was her looks. She had chestnut brown hair that went down to her shoulders and a face 'blessed by the Light' as her parents said. She was also considerably curvy in all the right areas, having a DD bust and matching thighs.

John took notice to this, and agreed to provide a very generous dowry to Emma's family if he was allowed to marry her. She begged her parents to not go through with it, but this year's crops had proved to be less than fruitful. In order to survive they had no choice but to give away their only daughter. Emma felt like a cow being herded to the slaughter. There she sat, staring out of the window on this beautiful summers day.

She sighed. "I wish something would happen to get me out of this mess..."

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Meanwhile you spun completely out of control through Elwynn Forest like you were in a time warp. Your soul had been severed from your own body and was desperately seeking refuge in some human form. It was unfortunate that the Stonewall's had decided to build so closely to the Abbey, because your soul sped right into their house. As you zipped through the walls like air, you felt a shuddering thud as your spirit connected with something. Everything went dark for a few moments.

You awoke to find yourself on the floor of a poorly decorated farm house. Your head wouldn't stop spinning as you slowly rose to your feet to see where you were. Elwynn Forest was still outside the window, so at least you hadn't teleported across the world when your spirit sundered, which you were thankful for. Suddenly the door behind you opened, a pudgy woman with dirt all over her arms and a handkerchief tying her hair together busted into the room.

"What happened honey!? I heard a loud thud coming from here." She said.

You raised an eyebrow, trying to figure out what she meant.

"I'm sorry, who are you-" You clasped your mouth. It wasn't your voice coming out! You noticed a strangely heavy feeling on your chest. You looked down and screamed. "WHAT IN THE NAME OF THE LIGHT IS THIS?!"

Staring back at you were two massive breasts under a white and blue dress. You suddenly noticed your hair was much longer as well! You looked at a nearby mirror and gasped. The reflection showed a beautiful brown haired woman instead of your normal Brother Stevens-like reflection! The Mind Control spell must have accidentally targeted whoever this was instead! The overweight woman shook her head.

"Stop being silly Emma dear. You must be well rested for your wedding tomorrow. Now wash up for dinner, okay?"

She left the room, leaving you alone to comprehend what she just said. Not only were you in the body of a woman, the woman was meant to get married tomorrow! You suddenly recalled being scheduled to wed a couple the next day as well....Talk about ironic. But you had to do something and fast before you ruined this budding young couple's life together!
11111.title: In the body of a farmer's daughter.

111111.content:
There was no chance in the Twisting Nether that you were going to wait around here to get married as a woman! There was only one thing to do. You climbed on the table and jumped out the window into the forest. Thankfully you recognized where you were, a farmhouse just outside the walls of the Abbey. You quickly sprinted for the road into Northshire. However one of the guards stopped you before you could enter.

"Whoa miss, where you going?"

It took you several seconds to realize he was talking to you. "Oh, Uh. I was just going to deliver something to...Brother Stevens."

The guard gave you a funny look. "It's information for my wedding." You answered quickly.

"Alright, sorry miss. We've just been getting an unusually large number of bandits attacks in the Abbey recently. Can't be too careful."

You thanked the Light that he allowed you to pass. You dashed towards where you had been practicing the Mind Control spell hoping to find your real body. It was there you discovered that...
111111.title: Make a break for it.

choices: I'll help you return to normal, at a cost.
Return to the Stonewell family and get married.
1111111.content:
In the middle of the same sunny gardens lie your body. Pale as death, but intact nonetheless. Thinking quickly, you lifted your old body's arms around your shoulders and hoisted yourself up, as weird as it was.

"I really need to lose some weight..." You joked to yourself as you made your way to the Abbey with your soulless corpse.

One of the Deputies noticed you and quickly ran over to give you a hand.

"Are you alright!? What happened?!" He yelled.

"I-I don't know," You tried your best to sound like a damsel in distress. "I just went over to Brother Stevens and he collapsed! I need to take him to Father Lightwell!"

The guard nodded and put your body's other arm over his shoulder. Father Lightwell was the head priest of Northshire Abbey. He was a excellent teacher, and a dear friend to you. If anyone would know what to do about this predicament, it would be him. You ascended the stairs with the guard until you reached the Father's study, right below the bell tower. Father Lightwell was reading an old tome when you and the guard barraged in.

"Oh dear me! Brother Stevens! What has happened Deputy!?"

"This young lady claims to have found Stevens collapsed on the ground in the gardens. We brought him to you, considering you are an expert healer."

"Very well...set him down on my desk here."

You grabbed your body's legs, while the guard grabbed both arms. Father Lightwell removed the parchment on the table to make room for your body. He gently pushed the hair from your face, and placed both hands on your head. A yellow light radiated from his hands, almost blinding you. When it died done, he had a look of concern on his face.

"Deputy, please fetch me a means of bringing Brother Stevens to a bed. He will need much rest."

The soldier nodded and hastily made his way out of the study. Father Lightwell studied you a moment, stroking his gray beard in deep thought. Until at last he spoke to you.

"Marcus. Were you practicing with that dangerous Mind Control spell?"

Busted. You flinched and stammered an answer. "Y-yes sir. Sorry I thought I could handle it the first time..."

Father Lightwell began to pace around the room. He was making you nervous.

"F-father, h-how did you know-"

"That's not important Marcus Stevens. What matters is that you ran from this situation without taking responsibility for your actions. If I'm not mistaken, the body you are inhabiting is that of Emma Stonewall. The very Emma Stonewall you were supposed to marry tomorrow! You could have destroyed her relationship with her family because of your actions! Priests are meant to help people!"

You felt like you were being scolded by your father. Of course, Father Lightwell was right in every way. You had been a coward, and probably destroyed Emma's life because of it.

"W-what should I do?"

Lightwell sighed.
1111111.title: Brother Stevens I presume?

11111111.content:
"There is a way," Continued Father Lightwell. "To return you and Emma to normal. But...I will only help you on one condition."

You gulped. "W-what is it?"

"You're going to stay like that for an entire month."

You couldn't believe what you were hearing. "WHAT!? But you just said-!"

"With my permission, the wedding will be postponed. I will explain to EVERYONE the situation including Emma's family. In the meantime you will resume your normal priest training such as you are. No complaints Marcus."

You were going to question him again but figured you were already in enough trouble. You sighed and bowed to Father Lightwell, continuing down the stairs and back to your quarters.

----------------------------------------------------------------

The next week was an extremely difficult test of patience. For days, your fellow priests mocked you because of your new female form. In fact the tailor made it a point to create the perfect robe such that no matter how you wore it, it always showed a massive amount of cleavage. Several members of the guard had even made passes at you, one almost even lured you to the vineyard alone. The worst of it, however, was dealing with the father and mother of Emma Stonewall. Both were beyond angry with you for your recklessness and sent ravenous complaints to you every day through either angry letters or going to the Abbey and yelling your ears off.

Life at the Abbey had become so chaotic that you took trips to the bar in Goldshire whenever you could. You'd spend your entire service earnings to drown your sorrows away in liquor, but nothing ever seemed to keep the local perverted males from hounding you with wolf whistles.

One day, after finishing a round, several men walked into the inn talking with each other. "Hey did you hear about that..."
11111111.title: The price of cowardice.

choices: Drink it, what have you got to lose?
111111111.content:
"...Fortune Teller in town? They say he's blind but he's probably the best I've ever seen! He predicted that I'd get incredibly rich yesterday and sure enough! I've inherited my father's entire plantation! I'm set for life!"

The other man frowned. "I don't know. I don't trust folks like that."

"Aw, come on! It's all in good fun! He's got a tent set up right outside the town. And visiting him is practically free."

Under normal circumstances, you would have regarded this conversation as the hearsay that it was. But feeling probably the worst you ever felt in a long time, and reasonably drunk, the taunting prospect of knowing what your future held made you curious. This entire week had been just plain awful, and a niggling doubt of uncertainty wrapped at the back of your mind that you might be stuck like this for the rest of your life. You shook your coin bag. Several jingles were heard, meaning that you hadn't yet throw away all your earnings.

You sighed. "What have I got to lose..."

------------------------------------------------------------

Moments later you found yourself standing outside a large purple tent covered in black runes. It was safe to say that this was the right place and you went right inside. The inside was much different from the colorful outside. A dark and musky smoke filled the small tent. There were shelves carrying odd jars all along the wall. In the center was a knee high table with a large clear ball shaped piece of glass. At the other end of the table sat a hooded man. He had a short gray beard and his eyes under the hood were clear white. As you entered he looked up and spoke in a pausing raspy voice.

"Greetings...Marcus Stevens..."

"Y-you know who I am?"

"Yes...I have been...expecting you...Sit..." He motioned to the cushion in front of you.

You quickly obliged and sat cross legged. The fortune teller continued to sit there breathing heavily as if he was deep in concentration. You took the opportunity to look around the tent some more. The jars had labels that said all sorts of bizarre things. "Pygmy Oil", "Giant Essence", or "True Air". There were also unlabeled potions placed in delicate wooden stocks. The fortune teller gave a rough cough, startling you.

"My apologizes...I was deep in a communication...with the other side...I know why you are here...Marcus Stevens..."

"Y-y- you do?"

"Yes...You need not worry...I have here a solution..." He pulled out a small vial from under his robes. "All you must do...is take one sip...You will be your true self..."

You took the potion from his shaking hands. It was very light and had a bright pink glow. The bubbles in the liquid danced in the light as you stared at them. But you sensed something was wrong.

"What's the catch?"

"There's is no catch...Marcus...Just drink the potion...You can call this...free service..."
111111111.title: Tell us a Fortune.

choices: Flee Elwynn Forest, and head to Theramore to start a new life.
1111111111.content:
Despite the worries of the situation, you decide to drink from the potion. It was rather small, no more larher than a shot of hard ale. You put it in your dainty hand and swigged it down; as soon as the ale touched your lips your vision blurred.Unfortunately, your vision quickly came back to you. You quickly looked down, unfortunately, only to see Emma's very feminine body still belonging to you.

"Why didn't it work?" you asked, your voice cracking and sounding even higher than normal.

"Oh, but it did... you are now your true self" replied the fortune teller.

"I don't feel any different at all" you replied, confused and slightly worried. The fortune teller was giving off a dark vibe.

"Why should you feel any different? You are Marcus.. in the soul, but not the body. But now, the physical Marcus, the real you that the world recognizes has been inhabited with Emma's brainwashed soul to forever believe she is and always has been you, and that he just drank a potion that restored him to his actual body. Thus, Emma's soul has transitioned into a copy of yours... I'm sure he's already off telling every other priest how he single-handedly reversed the spell."

"What!?" you nearly scream "You liar! How could you... reverse this treachery!". You quickly stand, pushing your chair back, and focus your mental power on conjuring the shadows from the depth of your mind in order to attack the Fortune Teller. Yet, for some reason, you literally blank at what to do - you can't remember the first step. You had fulfilled much of your priest training, but now you literally could not remember anything about it. This was completely unnatural and unexplainable, like forgetting something close to you... you felt it at the tip of your tongue but knew not a thing about it. You stood there, arms outstretched, unable to conjure a single spell.

"Well, it seems you've found the second part of the potion. As Emma's soul was untrained in fending off the shadow, yours unfortunately was... so you'll take longer. But I assure you, all your priestly, professional, and academic knowledge has been given to the real Marcus now. As that has happened, so has the opposite... your soul, mind, and now body have been filled with the knowledge Emma has acquired through her life, which, as she is a poor farm girl, isn't much. Just as she has already fallen to, also soon your emotions will be quite like hers - although likely never exactly parallel. I'm sure the hormones will help that though. Don't worry about your identity however, as your power had transgressed quite well, you will never truly forget who you were... you will just be unable to convince the world seeing as Marcus would say otherwise to you Emma, and you'd be quite unable to prove it with any knowledge on what you're actually saying... It'd simply look like you were mentally harmed from being possessed by Marcus for too long. Or maybe they'd think you'd been dabbling with the fel arts."

You find you are too lost for words to even respond, you are unable to fight and seem to be at his mercy now.

"I hope I've helped you to find your true self, Emma Stonewall" says the fortune teller before he dissapears in to a cloud of purplish smoke, leaving you alone in the fortune tellers tent.

You are left still standing, still very female, and mentally crippled compared to what you once knew. You collapse in despair in to the chair you had knocked away behind you, and feel your breasts bounce as you do so. You feel like crying, and wonder if it is part of the potion... but just manage to resist - probably because of the alcohol you had consumed prior that manages to numb your pain.

"No..." is all you manage to say with your light feminine voice. You don't want to be Emma Stonewall, a woman, a poor and soon to be married woman for the rest of your life. You had already grown quite tired of having to sit down to pee, and had been recently worrying about your period. If you stayed as Emma forever you would have to bare children, have a family! Maybe, you could escape - run away and start a new life? Or, you could pursue Priest, or rather Priestess training again... it would take years to literally relearn all of it again though. Or, you could do both?

At least, that seemes like a better idea then resigning to your fate, but maybe her fate wouldn't be that bad? She was about to be married to a rich noble, and surely he would carry you through life... but you would have to do... err... womanly things for him. You were disgusted at the thought.

Then again, maybe in time this could all blow over if you posed as Emma, or you could wait out an opportunity to explain your sitatuion to somebody who would listen.

You continued to sit anxiously in the chair, and finally, gave in to a single womanly tear that fell down your face. Every part of your body felt so off to what you once knew, and now your mind had been almost erased. You were defenseless in any situation. Weak, and trapped to a horrid fate. You had to do something.
1111111111.title: Never Trust a Strange Shot

choices: You are back inside your own body.
You are in the body of Sarah Runetouch. (Crossover from the Human Female story)
11113.content:
Suddenly the motion sickness and drifting of Brother Marcus Steven's soul stopped.

You felt attached suddenly, but surrounded in darkness. You had no idea what you had become, or where you were. Was this the endless void, the twisting nether? Were you going to be trapped in blackness, unable to move or feel forever?

Despite the inability to sense or perceive anything, you still managed to 'feel' a presence of powerful magic energy. You couldn't identify it, but it didn't feel like Shadow or Holy magic; the magic wasn't your own. Whatever you were with carried a powerful seal to it.

Drowned in despair, the only thing you still had was your own thoughts, but without senses, they even seemed to fade in time. You questioned how the mind control spell targeted something on its own, and how you were literally 'ripped' from your body. From what you had read, that was unnatural to the spell. Did something external interfere? You asked this many times... before you completely lost track of time. It could have been minutes, or it could have been hours, but eventually your mind and soul were awakened by a powerful and magical vibration that seemed to creep from within you. It was pushing you somewhere.

Being with nothing, you saw no risk and followed it. Slowly, the darkness turned to light, and then suddenly you were catapulted back in to reality.
11113.title: An object

choices: Hide. They could be robbers, rogues, or thugs!
111132.content:
You open your eyes and see darkness, still. But this wasn't the same type of darkness that you had been stuck in earlier, this was living darkness. You could see color, shape, and depth through this darkness! Slowly, your vision returned. From what you could tell, you were laying on the grassy floor of the Mage District in Stormwind. You laid there for a moment, still grasping the fact that you had human senses again. You were filled with appreciation for them.

You wondered how you got to Stormwind though, and rolled from your side on to your front.

"Ow! Fel!" you cursed aloud, but immediately rushed a hand to your lips. A lot of things were off. For one, as you rolled over your chest seemed closer to the ground then it had ever been, and something had squished on your chest which hurt horribly. For second, as you cursed your voice was extremely high pitched and smooth, almost feminine, and you didn't feel the familiar break of a voice crack as you talked. For third, as you brought your hand to your lip, you saw a dainty, soft, and almost beautiful hand with painted red nails. And for fourth, your could have sworn your lips were never this soft.

Despite all these offbeat sensations, you failed to piece together what had happened, and went in to a state of frenzied confusion. Quickly, you removed your hand from your lips and placed both of them on the ground to lift yourself up; unfortunately it was just as confusing as the other senses, because although you could swaur you felt lighter (Except for something that seemed to be weighing down your chest at an awkward protruding angle), it was FAR more difficult and muscle working than normal to lift your entire body up. You brought your legs up to just about your chest and used them to lift yourself in to a standing position.

Your heart had started beating as you quickly moved your head left and right to become better familiarized with your surroundings. A tiny strand of something blonde and light waved infront of your face... what was that? It was hair! Hair attached to your head!

Things started to come piecing together now, and you looked down to verify your senseless fears. Unfortunately, your fears did make sense. Below your neck you can see cleavage, that is very much attached to you! You are wearing a dark purple apprentice robe, that at least covers your legs. Unfortunately, much of your shoulders and cleavage remain visible.

The breasts attached to your body seem a lot bigger to you, but you know they can't be larger then C-cups. You bring your manicured hand to touch one, and instantly bring it away when you feel the touch on both sides. The breats are very much a part of you! From what you could tell, you were a woman - but you quite literally didn't have the balls to verify what was between your legs right now. You could already more then feel an unfamiliar absence as you had stood up.

"What the - what the fuck is going on!?" you whisper in a hiss to yourself. Your voice, now that you paid attention to it, was very much a womans. High pitch, light, smooth.

You take a second away from your fears and nightmare to observe your surroundings again. Below you was a strange statue on the ground. It was a strange two headed monster carved in stone - it looked like a hydra. It was shiny and black, like it had been well preserved despite looking like it was from ancient times. The eye sockets of both sides of the statue looked like they once held something, but they were empty. Around the statue, and in the eye sockets, were many fragments and shards from what looked to be broken rubies. Were those what was in the eyes? Did they just break? You reach down, rather awkwardly due to your new off-beat sense of balance, and pick up the object. It seemed to have some sense of importance. Maybe it was what you had been sucked in to?

You had bigger questions to ask right now though. Who were you? How long have you been gone? Where and what has happened to your actual body? How do you reverse this?

Confused and worried you decide to start walking towards Stormwinds exist, you wanted to get out of here - and going closer to your bodies last location seemed like the best idea. As you walked you realized just how awkward and completely different your new body was. You also took note to just how late it was outside, and the fact that nobody else was around.

As you neared the exit to the district you heard voices coming from around the corner. You couldn't make out what they were saying, but you could tell there was at least three men walking your way and they were just around the corner. This late at night, alone, and in an already bad situation you pause for a moment to debate what to do.
111132.title: Lost Mage in Stormwind

1111321.content:
You took a deep breathe and tried to maintain your composure. They were just a couple of men, possibly drunk, walking down the city path. Nothing to be nervous or scared about. You walked towards them, hips swaying like a lady.

They stopped their conversation. One of them was a dark iron dwarf and laughed. "Hot damn boys! We don't even have to go looking for our catch! Get her Zin!"

Before you could even respond, the tall one who appeared to be a high elf of sorts walked over to you with a large club in his hand. In your normal fit body you might have been able to fight him off but the elf easily was able to whack you over the head. You fell to the ground knocked out cold.

~

The events of last night were pieced together in your head like a jigsaw puzzle that was missing a few pieces. You vaguely recalled the three men, but most importantly you knew you were no longer in your old body.

In fact you weren't quite sure where you were. You had a blindfold covering your eyes and the distinct feel of cold iron clasped around your ankle. The bump on your head from the club had healed somewhat, so you assumed you had been out for a few days.

You were...
1111321.title: So much for that.

choices: It worked! You possess the Night Elf Pirate!
11113211.content:
You were still piecing together the events of last night, or was it a few nights ago now? You seemed to recall being sucked into an object, then being placed in the body of a woman, and then being attacked... was it all a dream? The blindfold on your eyes seemed to say it wasn't. Everything still felt weird too, you could tell you weren't in your body. So much for a dream, this had became a living nightmare. How many days had it been by now, anyways?

You were clearly sitting down against something wooden in a damp area. You felt a swaying, one similar to being on a boat, which you had grown quite familiar with as a child. A shackle was also around your ankle and was extremely tight - you could feel the pain from it having been in place for some time. You reached your unshackled hands up to the back of your head and grabbed the blindfold, feeling your long long and now matted and unkempt hair as you did so, and pulled it off. It didn't do much good for your vision, it was still very dark. You were clearly in a boats bottom-most cellar though. You could see outlines that looked like other living humanoids though, of many different species. Some were moving, others laying down. It was quite clear, from what you knew about Stormwinds recent crime problems, you were all being trafficed. To where, you had no idea, you could only hope that given your new body you weren't being sent to be sold for sexual purposes. The thought made your heart leap in fear.

"H-hello?" you whisper, shocked by the forced reminder of your light and smooth voice. Your new gender had now become only your second greatest worry.

"Don't speak!" hissed somebody, a male, from directly across from you, "They're outside. You don't wanna know what they-"

"Who's talking?!" came the loud voice of a tauren as he opened a door. Light shined in to the room, and you squinted your eyes in a lack of preparation. The tauren stepped in quickly, and cleared most of the chamber, ending up inbetween you and the stranger - who you could now see was a small gnome male. He had pink hair and was in some very unkempt rags, but now that the light had illuminated most of the chamber, you realized everyone was. You included. The tauren eyed you for a second, seemingly surprised that you were awake, then turned to the gnome.

"I heard your squeaky voice, midget" said the bovine "I don't want to tell you again!"

"Please, sir-" piped the gnome, but it didn't seem to be enough of a plea. The tauren swiftly brought his hoof up to the gnomes head and slammed it against the wood of the ship. You squinted in partial shock and guilt.

"You're finally awake, been days" said the tauren as he turned to face you "Don't get comfortable. But I'll see to it you get some food, you're lucky Hark thinks your a looker. Just know I think you're an ugly human, so you better keep your tramp mouth shut." The tauren then swiftly stepped back to the door he came in. Before the door shut, you glimpsed the gnomes state with the last bit of light that leaked in to the room. You were thankful that there was no blood, but the gnome had clearly been knocked out cold. You felt disgusting for causing it, and even more disgusting for being talked to like a female siren.

You slumped back to the wood, now unable to see anything again, and realized that the body you inhabited was starving! You hadn't noticed the hunger pains until the tauren mentioned food. You had been out a while. That was just another worry! You had to get out of here, get your life back - before it was taken from you in every way possible!

You pulled on the shackle that was attached to your foot, but it was obvious it wasn't going to break. Not even your priestly magic could do much about that... but you could stand your ground and fight from where you were. Or, you could try the mind control spell again! Maybe, just maybe, you could pull it off and use it to free yourself! You tried to stand, but the shackle restricted it. You would have to do any casting and fighting from near the floor. You felt around, and could tell you had a decent amount of space from any of your 'slave neighbors'. You brushed your legs as you explored your surroundings, and concentrated on ignoring their smoothness and skinniness for now. Your hunger and new body would make everything you were about to do hard...

Suddenly light shone in again; it wasn't the tauren entering either. A night elf male in raggy (But not slave-like) pirate clothing stepped in, carrying a tray of food. He eyed you and started to approach. It was now or never. You focused on conjuring the energy and mana in your mind and transforming it in to shadow energy; you thought about projecting your mind outward and in to the elf with the shadows as the link between you and dominating his mind. The shadow energy coursed through your hands and channeled outward...
11113211.title: The trafficing trade.

choices: You somehow lose your female body.
111132111.content:
You felt like you were being catapulted into the air. The Night Elf Pirate's face was the last thing you saw before....darkness. Like a curtain being opened, the light of the world around you returned. You could see clearer than before. There wasn't a blindfold to cover your eyes. In front of you was a small blond woman, looking completely confused. Next to her was an unconscious gnome. You dropped the tray of food and started feeling through your pockets.

"Keys...keys...where are the keys?" You muttered to yourself. Though it wasn't your real body, the last thing you wanted to do was leave that poor girl's body on a pirate ship. You were a priest after all.

You pointed at your 'old body'. "You, where did you keep the keys?"

"Wha-wha!? Who said that!? Where am I!? And why do I sound so-"

"Just shut up and answer! Where did you keep the keys for the cell!?"

"I-I kept the keys in my back trouser pocket...I think..."

Feeling around you grasped the metal handle and jammed it into the lock. You ripped off the girl's blindfold, her eyes widened.

"Y-you're...me!? And I'm..." She looked down and almost screamed.

"No time to explain 'princess'! You lot!" You tossed the key to the nearby prisoners after finishing unlocking the girl's shackles. "Take it and get yourselves out of here. Quick, I don't want that tauren to come back!"

Thankfully this swashbuckler had the sense to keep a saber on his person. Before your priestly training you had engaged in some rather...questionable behavior. You weren't a master with swords but it would probably be enough to get you out of any trouble. You needed to escape on a raft or small boat. Hopefully there was a spare on this ship. Before the girl could protest you threw her over your shoulder. This night elf was well built, she weighed next to nothing.

"What's going on in there!?" Yelled a voice from behind the door leading to the deck.
111132111.title: Shiver me timbers.

choices: You find the girls body... sort of.
1111321112.content:
It was obviously the voice of the tauren. Before you could even move a step, he was standing and guarding the small staircase out of the holding area. You were the closest of the lot of prisoners to him too; after all, this was your escape to lead. You quickly withdrew the cutlass that the Night Elf had on his belt and raised it ahead of you. The Blink spell was one that you could see any mage doing in the Trade District simply because of the mobility it granted them. As the name suggested, it was as if you had blinked and suddenly teleported a few yards in front of you. Since the mage wasn't really light particles, the distance traveled wouldn't be nearly as far, but it was enough to escape the crushing stomp of a giant's feet or skip over a small river. Being made of light particles also meant you could travel though anything, or anyone.

In theory, it was quite simple. For you on the other hand...Well, the last time you tried it, you ended up getting stuck in between a door.

She was no doubt referring what had remained of her equipment which was scattered all along the wear where you had landed. You quickly donned the biggest robe you had in your closet, which belonged to one of your more "larger" conquests, and swiped up the staff. It was very ornate and clearly of Pandaren design, though it was sturdy and would hurt if it hit you on the head.

"Got it," you said, trying to adjust with your new larger, but still tight, clothing.

"Nothing," you replied. "The pandaren, Nashinji, whose body I'm in is still present in my mind. It really is like we just fused together. Do you have any ideas on how to fix this, master?"

The old wizard stroked his beard, making it clear he was still very disappointed in you but giving the matter some serious thought. After a moment of silence, he said. "I don't have a clue."

"What!?" Nash shouted in your head, making your ears twitch. "You mean I'm stuck like this forever!?"

You, however, retained a calmer attitude. "There is no solution to fix this, then?"

"As you are aware, it is simple to separate an inanimate object from a living being because there's no risk of losing something from the object. Ripping apart two living beings from one, however, is a complicated matter. You could end up missing some vital components like organs, or even your soul..."

His voiced trailed, tempting you to keep silent.
